The beans are shipped to the official Hershey's factory, located in North America,  Pennsylvania. The beans are taken through a series of steps called Cocoa processing, though Roasting, Winnowing (getting rid of shells), Milling (making coca liquor), Pressing, Refining (smoothening), Counching, Tempering (passed through heat/cooling to solidify the chocolate ), Moulded, and finally packaged.

attributes.description:
Approximately two thirds of the cocoa production is based in West Africa. Before the harvested beans are shipped to the factories, it has to go through a process called fermentation. It is a process where the workers place the seed (with the pulp sticking out) and cover it with banana leaves then left to ferment (brew) . The heat of the fermentation changes the flavor of the beans into something more edible to mankind. After fermentation, the beans are dried in the sun for approximately a week before it is shipped to the factories where the cocoa processing occurs. 

Where Does Chocolate Come From? Does It Grow on Trees?" Where Does Chocolate Come From? How Chocolate Is Grown. Web. 15 Mar. 2012. <http://www.facts-about-chocolate.com/where-does-chocolate-come-from/>.

Among the percentage, Hershey's Chocolate uses a large amount of the cocoa beans produced from there. However, child labour is often used to obtain the cocoa beans. In addition, cocoa workers who are paid, receive wages that leave them at the edge of poverty and starvation
